heading: passage: joseph heller, 76
subheading: author joseph heller died sunday of a heart attack at his home in east hampton, new york. he was best known for his darkly humorous anti-war novel catch 22, which became a cult favorite in the vietnam war era. the book was based on the writer's experiences as a world war ii bombardier. heller's other novels, including something happened and good as gold, sold respectably, but did not achieve the same success as catch 22.
